devices.HDDLTooltip: Intel® Vision Accelerator Design with Intel® Movidius™ VPUs

warnings.incompatibleDevices: NCS2 and HDDL cannot be used simultaneously

labels.configureHDDL: Configure Intel® Vision Accelerator​ Design with Intel® Movidius™
labels.runHDDLDaemon: Run Intel® Vision Accelerator​ Design with Intel® Movidius™ daemon
labels.runDockerWithoutSudo: Manage Docker as a non-root user

installDockerInstructions.linux: Follow instructions on installing Docker on Linux. To verify the installation, type "docker --version" in the Terminal. If Docker is installed, you will see its version.
installDockerInstructions.windows: Follow instructions on installing Docker on Windows. To verify the installation, type "docker --version" in the Windows PowerShell. If Docker is installed, you will see its version.
installDockerInstructions.macOS: Follow instructions on installing Docker on macOS. To verify the installation, type "docker --version" in the Terminal. If Docker is installed, you will see its version.

descriptions.runDockerWithoutSudo: Follow instructions on running Docker containers without sudo.
descriptions.windowsCommandComment: # Run this command in Windows PowerShell
descriptions.configureHDDLInstructions: Use the Configuration Guide to set up the dependencies on the host system.
descriptions.installPythonWindows: Follow instructions on installing Python on Windows. Python Starter works with Python 3.6–3.9. Select "Add Python 3.X to PATH" option during installation. To verify the installation, type "python --version" in the Windows PowerShell. If Python is installed, you will see its version.

allocateMemoryForDocker.macOS: Allocate at least 8GB Memory in the Docker Desktop settings.
allocateMemoryForDocker.windows: Allocate at least 8GB Memory in the Docker Desktop settings. Uncheck "Use the WSL 2 based engine" to manually configure the required resources.

descriptions.installPip: Follow instructions on installing Python package manager (pip). To verify the installation, type
descriptions.checkPipVersion: If pip is installed, you will see its version.
